New Records: Mark Vientos matched Daniel Murphy's total of 11 RBIs in the postseason
Key Match Events: Mark Vientos hit a grand slam after an intentional walk of Francisco Lindor
The Mets rallied in the second inning on a hit, a walk, and a Tyrone Taylor RBI double
The game was a 7-3 win for the Mets, evening the series at one game apiece
Pre-Game Insights: Opposing manager Dave Roberts called for an intentional walk of Francisco Lindor
Mark Vientos said he took the intentional walk 'personal' and was motivated to hit a home run
Post-Match Reflections: Mark Vientos said he was confident and believed in himself, and that he's grown up as a player
Teammate J.D. Martinez praised Vientos' 'South Florida grit' and 'edge to him'
Opposing manager Dave Roberts said Vientos got a big hit after a mistake with the heater
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets' victory required five-plus effective innings from starting pitcher Sean Manaea

Mark Vientos has matched Daniel Murphy's total of 11 RBIs in the postseason and is one shy of the Mets record of 12
Others: Mark Vientos was nicknamed 'Swaggy V' for his confidence and fashion sense
Vientos has around a dozen pairs of flashy shoes stacked in front of his locker at home in New York
